snippet: Each spring, a woman would show her breasts and be cited or arrested, but in February, the police made sure officers knew the behavior wasn’t illegal.
abstract: New York City Police officers are told that women being topless is not criminal; command might have been prompted by Holly Van Voast, Bronx photographer and performance artist known for baring her breasts in public and who has filed federal lawsuit against city and department; memo makes clear that bare-breasted women should not be cited for public lewdness, indecent exposure or any other section of penal law.
lead_paragraph: Each spring, a woman would show her breasts and be cited or arrested, but in February, the police made sure officers knew the behavior wasn’t illegal.

headline.seo: A Police Roll-Call Reminder: Women May Go Topless
headline.main: See Topless Woman? Just Move On, Police Are Told
headline.print_headline: Topless Woman? Move On, Police Are Told
